definition: to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: Is the word to be replaced, my son to help me point out the spot.
sentences.chinese: 是现改的词，儿子当场帮我点破。

sentences.english: But it did take some gumption for you to come out and say it.
sentences.chinese: 但是，你站出来点破这一点的确需要一些勇气。

sentences.english: To settle a simple matter like this won't take more than two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 这点破事两分钟就办完了。

sentences.english: If I am lost for a day.
I didn't point out what he was really after.
sentences.chinese: 我没有点破他的真实意图。

sentences.english: Life is a puzzle, the answer should not be brought in.
sentences.chinese: 既然是谜，就不该把底点破。

sentences.english: Brown point out the pool in Beichen "love Tess Anlin, Andrew lin love you".
sentences.chinese: 布朗点破池北辰“泰斯喜欢安霖，而安霖喜欢你”。
